Reviews.Title: “Best resort camping in Kissimmee, Fl.”
Reviews.Author: Guy G
Reviews.Content: To each its own opinion as you see by the mixed reviews but for us this is a GREAT camp ground. Our opinion 5 star. We agree with some of the reviews. PROS: Great location, out of the traffic noise but centrally located to most popular activities. Clean grounds. Large sites. Good security, safe. Quiet and friendly. CONS: A little pricy, bath houses do need daily attention. NEW: Camp site cement pads are a welcomed new addition to the sites. New this year is the abillity to pre-reserve specific sites. We are not swimmers, but can appreciate other reviewiers comments tha the pool was crowded, but, facillities new and inviting. GPG

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Hedo-goer
Reviews.Content: Our group of 5 stayed in one of the cabins. The master bedroom, the bunkbeds in another room, and the bed in the loft suited us perfectly. The room was clean, but when we checked in, the linens hadn't been changed from the previous occupant. A call to the office soon corrected that. There were no bugs in our cabin, or even out on the deck. Cooking meals there saved us money, although every chain restaurant in the USA seems to have a spot on the main drag. The pool was small, but wasn't overcrowded when we were there. The pond has at least one alligator in it, and some people mentioned that there was a second gator, but I didn't see 2. The location of the campground is the best feature, as it is close to many things, but set off from the main drag. We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be back home!”
Reviews.Author: mpdneal
Reviews.Content: I find myself puzzled by all the recommendations/reviews in favor of Tropical Palms. It was horrible but it certainly was not all that great. Upon pulling in everything looks really nice. I just found myself to be disappointed at the conditions of the bath houses. Just in general not very convenient for taking a shower and getting ready/dressed. How about some hooks or somewhere to set your belongings down? The bath house clearly had not been cleaned in some time. We stay at a lot of campgrounds and know that they generally get pretty messy quickly but there was just dirt everywhere. I saw the same dirt and crime and streaks all week. The soap dispensers and paper towels were constantly empty and the trash cans were always overflowing. Not impressed. The pool is the real joke. It is crowded and loudand very small. There are so many people in the pool that I was grossed out. So grossed out that I did not go in once. People were everywhere. Just not an enjoyable pool experience for us! It's too bad because the pool building and cafe are in nice shape just too many people in one small pool. The cafe at the pool is decent and food and beverage prices are reasonable which is nice. I couldn't pack up fast enough here. Overpriced and crowded. I also didn't the area. Just felt unsafe and uncomfortable. Disappointed because i thought we found a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Love Tropical Palms”
Reviews.Author: Jean R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 10 days....have had a great experience. We ate lunch in the cafe several times...food was great and prices were reasonable. The luau was alot of fun. We thought $10 for food and entertainment was a great price...and $2.50 for a draft beer was awesome. The night before we walked up to Old Town at one of the bars and paid $13 for two drinks...with no entertainment. The Wi-Fi is extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “I love this campground, but the extra charges drove me away”
Reviews.Author: smile_u_nut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in one of the 2bedroom cottages, I loved it, the pool area is fantastic with the heated pool and all the activities they have poolside, what doesn't seem right to me on this is they charge you 5.00 everytime you want clean towels and to have a maid it is 20.00 to clean your room, isn't that what we are paying for in the first place?? Because of these extra charges I have moved locations.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: catnewall
Reviews.Content: pool area was nice, maybe a little small but still a very reasonable size. one key thing for us was its location. 30 mins from disney, seaworld and loads more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price and amenities, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Galadriel_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our grandaughters there during spring break and really enjoyed our stay there a few years ago and are planning a return trip next year. Cabins have modern accommodations, fully equipped kitchen, decent size bedrooms, close to all theme parks and shopping. Downside was the tv was old and did not have good reception and the furniture in the living room was old, uncomfortable and needs to be replaced. May have been replaced by now. Also liked the cabin's deck with bbq and heated pool was nice. It is located in the heart of Kissimmee, but you can't tell since it is located a few blocks off of the main street thru town, it was very quiet and we felt safe there. I recommend this place to anyone looking for value in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “The best 10 days of Winter”
Reviews.Author: cosby44
Reviews.Content: I was just recently @ Tropical Palms with my wife and 8 month old along with my in laws and brother in law. We had the best time ever, we played shuffle board together for a few hours every morning and sat by the pool for a few hours every afternoon and had a couple of wobbly pops along the way. I would recommend staying here if you want to be close to Disney but not right in the hustle and bustle. Overall, great 10 days away from winter....

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully place”
Reviews.Author: Campingfan1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tropical Palms for the first time and I loved it. People are friendly, nice pool and palms all over the campground. I stayed in my travel trailer and it was great. They have everything you might need - convenient store, propane - even rental car company with nice rental cars available on site. Great place! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and will go back”
Reviews.Author: margeCanada
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our vacation at Tropical Palms and enjoyed it very much. The grounds were beautiful and we really enjoyed the pool(Happy Hour M-F). There are lots of things to do while visiting the restort. Extra dinners to attend with a band, Superbowl party (plans in the works)etc. Disney is close by and that is a plus. Staff were friendly as well. We made many new friends and did not meet any person with a negative thing to say about the resort. In fact most of the folks, were ones that had been there for years and kept coming back. We will return next year as well. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Xmas here...”
Reviews.Author: Travelninja76
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for the Xmas holiday with my wife and three kids. We had a splendid time. it certainly helped that a warm front came through and gave us eighty degree weather on Xmas!!! the cottage we stayed in was a deluxe cottage. The cottage was clean, had all the amenities we wanted (iron, full kitchen, wifi). The wife and kids enjoyed the pool and I enjoyed the walks around the resort. There is also a small convenient store, where we got frozen pizzas and refreshments. All in all it was a great place to stay and would be near the top of where we would stay again if we're in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Had to move into 3 different cottages.”
Reviews.Author: Tina M
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived the week prior to Christmas 2011 and were excited because we have stayed here 3 other occasions over the past 10 years and were booked into a "premium" cottage. It appeared well maintained and clean but to our horror it was infested with roached. We killed no less than 20 on our first night there. We were moved into a brand new cottage that had never been occupied and the air did not work and was moved yet again to another cottage. Though this cottage was obviously intended to be an upgrade I was diasppointed as it seemed to have a roach problem as well in addition to a stopped up drain that backed water up into the tub while you were showering. The worst was the loud noise coming from the refridgerator that sounded like a "weedeater". I was very disappointed as we had purchased season tickets for Disney and planned to return in the summer for vacation and planned to book our vacation before we left. Needless to say we did no rebook and will not be returning. Very discouraging because the property is very well maintained and a good location. Not sure if ownership has changed since our previous stay but obviously they are focused on the cosmetic appearances and not the actual cleanliness of the facility

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE & QUIET LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dblead
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying there in over 20 yrs. Nice large cottages, playground, swimming pool. It is also an up-scale campground. Situated just 10 min from WDW in a quiet side street next to "Old Town" in Kissimmee. Our large cottage had 2 king beds plus a loft for 2 children. Fully equiped kitchen central air & heat, TV, & a large deck. We paid 65.00 a day with our AAA travel card. Now the older cottages (ours) are a little rough & need refurbishment, but they were clean & everything worked. They have newer more expensive cottages if you are fussy. All at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “They added false charges to my bill!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuPineapple
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER stay here again!! The last time I stayed at Tropical Palms, they added fake charges to my bill. I called and spoke with Chris, who confessed that the charges were for services rendered on a date prior to my arrival. However, I could not get anyone to "do the right thing" and adjust my bill. Crooks!

Reviews.Title: “never going back”
Reviews.Author: dan f
Reviews.Content: if you could give a 5 star rating for customer service that is what they should get but the cottages themselves are horribile.we had stayed here several years ago under the old ownership and once under the new ownership.we had ant problems then but nothing we could'nt live with.this time we got two of the newer units and when we checked in and got to the cottage we found dead baby german roaches,so we knew the cottage had not been cleaned ,we ask to be moved and the staff gladly moved us.we inspected the next unit and found no bugs at this time.the next problem was no hot water,again the staff was right on it and sent the maintance man over and he explained that the handles were on backwards and showed us how it worked.what he forgot to tell us was you either had to get wet,turn it off ,soap up and turn it back on to rinse off.if you did it this way 1 3/4 persons could get a hot shower and then it was at least a 2 hour wait to get enough hot water for the next person.the next night after being at the parks all day we head back to the cottages for showers and a nights sleep,wrong!.with the lights on ,my wife finds a roach (huge) crawling on the wall in the bedroom and about the same time we hear our friends in the next cottage scream,her 3 year old daughter was setting on the floor and a roach ran acrossed her,that was the last straw and went to the office, in the mean time my wife is packing up and moved some of the clothes and another roach takes off.the front office offers to move all of us but that was not an option,we had already been moved once with the same results.the staff agrees to give back the money for that night and the next night,which was fine but it's 11pm with the kids that was already asleep and now we have to find another place to stay,which we did but for more money,we packed up and headed fot the nick hotel and got there around midnight.now we had the next big problem,at the end of our stay we now had to face the fact that our luggage and our car was more then likely going to have roaches in them.so we have to make arrangements to have the exterminator meet us at the house on a sunday afternoon to spray the cars and the luggage and the house to make sure we don't get infested.i have lived in florida for 30 years and have never had a bug problem because we have the exterminator.There is no excuse for having that big of a bug problem and think of the health problems.The staff was great and i know they can only do what corporate tells them to do.they did end up giving us back all the money including the one night we did stayed,thank you .but our two families drive up to disney 6 to 8 times a year because our daughters our into baton and are always in a parade,along with about 30 other families but we will never stay or recommend the Tropical palms to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never coming back!!!”
Reviews.Author: melissa d
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Tropical Palms numerous times over the years. It used to a wonderful place to stay and unwind from a long day at Disney. Things have changed. The prices have increased but yet the place has gone down hill. Upon arrival we were told the cottage we had reserved to accomodate all of us was not available and that we could have two smaller cottages. We agreed. Well the two smaller cottages were in the part of the resort that has not been updated. Basically they are cottages that people use to live in. These cottages are outdated and gross!!! We walked in to find the furniture looking like it was pulled from a dumpster. There was a spiderweb with a spider running from the couch to the end table, obviously the place had not been cleaned in sometime. The bathroom light was broke and would not turn on. Then the worst part was what I say were cocker roaches running under the fridge when we turned the lights on. I was told these were actually beetles, but I am not sure I agree. Needless to say I went back to the front desk and told them we would not be staying here and that I wanted a full refund. I would have felt safer sleeping in the rental vehicle compared to those beds. I will never ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: blklondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort for two weeks. Came with an open mind, and had a great time. The staff were really nice and friendly. The cottage we stayed in was very clean and big. It looked just like the website pictures. Made a few friends with others staying in the same area. This is one place that we will love to come back to again. Like home from home here. We have told friends and family to go and stay there. Look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Campground!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa S
Reviews.Content: Great for families of all ages. Toddler play area/ground and shallow toddler/baby pool. All areas are gated and secure. Larger pool for bigger kids and adults. Movies by the pool. activites. mini golf (really small but great for kids). shuffle board, bocci ball, volleyball area and basketball court. Grounds are clean. showers spotless. Campground is quiet at night. Staff is super friendly, Dog friendly too. Old Town is a 2 minute walk from campground. 15 minutes to disney. We go back several times durring the year.. kids loove it. ages 16-infant !

Reviews.Title: “We come here every time”
Reviews.Author: sadabthisstay
Reviews.Content: I will give you, its a little older and doesnt have all the luxuries of a hotel ( every day room cleaning, down comforters etc) but this place is perfect for larger groups or even families. We travel here often, because even during peak times you can get a cabin of 1-3 bedrooms for under $100.00 recently we traveled with our newborn and the accomodations were perfect. We set his pack and play up right outside our room, we were able to sit on the porch while he was inside, instead of our previous trip with him where going outside required packing him into his stroller and toting him with us. the grounds are well kept and quiet. we love it

Reviews.Title: “Kendall/Courts 2011 Family Reunion - Florida”
Reviews.Author: Frances B
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank the Tropical Palms Resort staff for their great hospitality, food and all their kindness.. The family really enjoyed themselves. If we could have stayed longer believe me we would have. Thank also for sharing pictures of our event on your facebook page. You were very accomodating and everyone of our planned events went smoothly with your help. Many of of are planning to come back to the Tropical Palms Resort . Our children thought our stay was too short. Great Job and we appreciate you. Frances (Tiny) Bailey Kendall/Courts Family Reunion Committee Member

Reviews.Title: “Well....”
Reviews.Author: cly516
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the place is fairly convenient to Old town and to Disney however, I have stayed here at the minimum of 6 times over the past three years (RV site). I can say because they are in Orlando/Kissimmee, they do not care if you are not satisfied with their services or their place. If you try to make it right good luck it will take a lot of work and a lot and frustration. It seems its getting worse and in this economy you would think they would at least try to make things right. Oh the wifi doesn't usually work, the pool is around 100 degrees and so not refreshing. But like I said it is convenient so make sure when you speak to someone regarding your reservations make sure YOU tell the what you expect. Also friends and family have stayed in cottages ya not so great,cute by yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cabin and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Avidvacationer6
Reviews.Content: Cute cabin but small. Good for family of four but very tight for family of six. Master bedroom only fits the queen size bed and maybe a mid-sized suitcase. Other room had bunk bed and twin bed. Sleeper sofa takes u dining and sitting area when opened. It feels more like a travel trailer than a cabin. Staff was very nice and quick when checking in and out. Pool area very nice. Plenty of things for kids to do. Would do again but kids are growing so too small for future visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind....”
Reviews.Author: Learical
Reviews.Content: I am here now. If you don't mind a little building neglect, stained carpet, no toaster, dirty pots (no excuse as there is a dishwasher in our cottage, very slow response from housekeeping, ants in kitchen, no parking at unit, confusing lay-out, then it's great. Price was good, tho. Saving grace...my internet works in this cottage....lol

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little getaway”
Reviews.Author: MrsMonk1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cottages and they were very nice! We stayed in a 2 bedroom with a loft, which provided privacy between my parents and the kids! The pool was great and there were activities for kids and adults, i.e. hula hoop contest, holding your breathe underwater contest, etc... There was a nice kiddie pool with a fountain shower for the little ones! Very relaxing and entertaining! There was also a basketball court and volleyball court that kept my son entertained. Not even a mile down the road is Old Town entertainment park with rides, shopping, go karts, restaurants, live entertainment, car shows, and more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: heidim44
Reviews.Content: We love Tropical Palms!! We visit about 8 weekends a year and spent an entire week last summer. Our kids prefer Tropical Plams over Fort Wilderness!! We have met some life long friends while camping here!! The pool and activities are great for families. They have all kinds of games and activities along with a DJ on the weekeends!! It is a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Laynebug
Reviews.Content: My family and I only stayed for 3 days, but it was well worth it! We played in the sun as well as in our air-conditioned camper. The pool was were we spent most of our time, which was amazing! They had a DJ, kids crafts, and a movie for the whole family(Madagascar that night)! You can drive your golf cart around the whole park, and even by the alligator pond! Overall, this vacation was one of the best we have been on! Thanks for all the good times Tropical Palms, see you in the summer time!

Reviews.Title: “Best campsite & resort!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor_x3
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Tropical Palms when i'm in orlando, I never stay anywhere else. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and they always have fun events going on at the pool like a dine-in movie, and DJ on the weekends. The cottages are nice, clean and cozy. They always have fun events going on during holidays too. It's also in walking distance to Old Town which is very convenient. I'm never disappointed when I visit. I would rate Tropical Palms a 20/10 :)

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best.”
Reviews.Author: Carole1944
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we decided on Tropical Palms. All the amenities super, the pool, the cafe, the RV sites, we even peered into the cottages, and the staff are A1 in service and go the extra mile to insure a great vacation. We will return next year for 4 months!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE EVER Without a Doubt !”
Reviews.Author: nancerw
Reviews.Content: Tropical Palms is our home away from home. This is by far one of the best campground in the area !!! Staff is attentive , cabins are super cute, Campsites are Great...very spacious and reasonably priced. Activities, games, Pool, mini golf, plenty of things to do nearby. You cant go wrong staying here. WE Love it and spend most of our summer weekends sitting by the pool listening to music. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE...Holidays are the best.. Especially.Halloween ..this is the Best place to be !!!!! In the summer they have $5 dollar all day slide rides. There's so much to do its too much to list....

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money unless you like rats, rodents and bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: angelfish879
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. We had rats or mice eat at our bread and bagels. We had to kill three cock roaches while there. And my 4year old son woke up in the middle of the night crying and screaming something bite him. We lifted up his nightgown and he had bite marks on his chest. Property needs alot of work and updates as well. Even the towels they provided to us were all stained. I don't even know if they were cleaned. The only good thing about the resort was that it was close to disney world. It wasn't that expensive either but it still was not worth the money. They really need to call a pest control place to get their problem under control. And maybe a lawn company to mow their grass which hadn't been mowed in a while.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH FOR THE FIRE ANTS”
Reviews.Author: united1889
Reviews.Content: Back camground is completely infested with fire ants. got in our trailer, on beds, we were full of bits, we had to have the trailer fumigated. Staff were very helpful, Even put us up in a cottage for the night(although i was afraid of the condition of the cottage). Very Close to all amenities. We will remember this trip for ever but not for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place, location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Nicki61
Reviews.Content: 3rd time renting a cottage. We rented a platinum. They are newer, 2 bedroom. It was nice, they get used alot. Not always kept up to top notch standards, but ok. It was clean, but it does need some love. Things needing replacing: some window blinds, glass door blinds & bedspreads. But it has everything needed in the kitchen, although a SMALL 4 cup coffee pot. It isn't cheap to stay here though. Roughly $1000 a week! So that is why I say location, location, location. Old towne right in front, Disney so close! That is why we come here. the pool is warm, the cafe is serving great food now and drinks! Don't over expect, and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible is to good for this place!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: drocke33
Reviews.Content: After staying at Tropical Palms in 2003, we decided to come back in 2010. Tropical Palms was very nice, clean and fun! Upon arrival 12-27-10, I was surprised to see that the house we got was so dirty, kids were starving, I reached up for a fry pan and found it was DIRTY; I should not have to walk into a place to stay and have to clean after check out of 11:00 and check in of 4:00. I was told the house was being cleaned from the prior guests this was not the case. I washed it and made our dinner. I called the office to inform them that we found crackers on the table and floor, Bedroom drawers were broke and unable to be used, I told Stacy not to worry about that but the door from our bedroom was jacked up. I cleaned kitchen, floors and counter. We went swimming and came back, put TV on to find we really had bad reception, we went to bed. Big days ahead with 7 days of park passes. Up early, made breakfast, cleaned up and left for park. Came back at midnight, put kids to bed, tried to hook up to internet there was none available, called front desk, no help! Went to bed. Got up 12-29-10, went to park, got home after midnight, put kids to bed. My daughter woke me up 1:30 AM, found a cockroach in her bedroom (we have in a zip lock bag). We looked for hotels (15 mile search) nearby and all were full. We then looked around and found no more bugs alive, only dead ones on kitchen cabinets. I told her it was probably a fluke & go back to bed, now 4AM. Got up early and back to park 12-30, back after midnight, put kids to bed and turned on bathroom light and found a fast moving cockroach from sink to under toilet! We are now done, Had to wake up kids, pack our clothes and food at 1:30 called front desk to inform of the concerns and was told "okay" by desk clerk. I let a lot of things go such as the slanted steps, dirty glass door trim, melted lamp shade, Receptacle falling out of the wall, broken pocket door, bad reception on TV, no internet, Mold on bathroom sink and on plastic in fold out sofa, two holes in wall in bedroom, and two many cockroaches too stay.no sleep for two nights made our New Years a bust. We missed Bret Michael's because we were too tired due to exhaustion from this ordeal. As soon as we returned home we took all of our clothes to a laundry mat so we didn't chance bringing any cockroach eggs into our home. Folks I have pictures of all that I have explained book at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Find another RV park”
Reviews.Author: WanderingTheUSA
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, don't stay here long term! There is a massive red ant problem in the 400 and 200 lots. They do not include pest control in there high rates! They are not very pet friendly and will complain if your dog barks. If you get any type of discount, they will evict you when there peak season hits. The pool heater is often broken and the water to the sites is frequently off! The cottages are very dirty. I agree strongly with the other posts regarding holes in the walls, strained bedding, filth, and lack of maintance. The customer service will be friendly upon check in and any problems/issues/concerns will be ignored after that! The manager is actually the owners son from Canada. He's very young and pompous. I wish we would had paid for a shorter stay and not seasonal. They don't offer refunds (including loud parties by young folks!) Keep on moving down the RV list to make sure your vacation is not ruined over your stay! Check out Lake Magic. They are closer to Disney and alot more friendly!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: biggerbelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our disney trip I spent alot of time pricing and looking for the perfect place to spend the week without spending alot. we were very dissapointed when we booked premium cottage and the web site said it had a queen bed and we got there it had a full. I even called twice to confirm and asked about the bed. We loved the little cottage and were reluctant to complain so I just wanted them to know that the website had diffent specs then the actual cottage. They upgraded us to a platinum. this cottage is alot nicer we had a king bed and more space for our 3 boys. the park is nice clean and has a beautiful pool. We drove to disney every day it takes about 12 minutes. thanks to the great and friendly staff for making our disney trip more memorable

Reviews.Title: “Cute cottage for the $”
Reviews.Author: staugustinefl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a platinum cottage with loft. The kids loved the loft but next time I would bring a small fan b/c it got very stuffy in the loft. Paid $89 with Florida residents discount. Pool is decent and had a grille that serves hamburgers, hotdogs, wings/beer etc... prices are awesome! Very laid back...you can order a beer and drink it in the pool. Lots of weekend activities for the kids. Weekdays tend to be less busy. Fourth stay with tropical palms and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful Staff & Reasonable Rate, but Cottages Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: Lyia8100
Reviews.Content: I have mixed emotions about the Tropical Palms Resort. There are pros and cons about the resort. Pros include: Friendly staff, quiet area, very close to Disney World, wireless internet, amenities like pool and laundry room, we were given plenty of towels for olnly 2 people. If you are on a tight budget, consider staying here. For the $59 rate, I won't and can't complain too much, but I would like to see some repairs made to our cottage #119 and others as well. Repairs needed included: re-painting the outside, fixing a small water leak near the closet, blinds and smoke alarm fixed in the loft area. Cons: Repairs and updating needed, some cottages only have a small fridge (we were moved to a new one after check-in and discovered the AC didn't work), had a maintenance worker pressure washing our building one afternoon interupting our rest (we were not notified of this or anything), not very many TV channels, needs some extra kitchen utensils like cheese grater and pitcher.

Reviews.Title: “The best trailer park in the world”
Reviews.Author: family_guy_32
Reviews.Content: This is not a trailer park in the bad way. The people that visit the place are really friendly and nice. The service is great and the cabins we stayed in (Platinum) are in very good condition. This has to be on of the best value for money acommodation alternatives in Kissimmee/Orlando. The swimming pool area has both a large pool for kids and adults and a fenced toddler pool with a top noch play area next to it. You can also play mini golf and fish in the local pond. The only negative for us was that the smoke detector is a little bit too sensitive and makes it challenging to cook (which is a shame beacuse we had a brand new kitchen). They could also do a little bit better job of vacuming under the beds. Apart from that everything was clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: McGregorgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this resort. The first was in April of this year. For the April trip I travel with extended family and we booked three cottages. One at each level. This was a research trip to check out the resort for a possible family reunion site.We didn't let the staff know what we were up to and booked this via the resort web site. On the April trip I stayed in a premium 2 bedroom cottage. On the trip in October I stayed in a platinum 2 bedroom cottage. Both were clean and well maintained. They both had full kitchens. This save us a ton of cash on meals out. The location is wonderful only a few min. drive to Disney. The pool area, pool bar and snack bar were great and resonably priced. Pool side games were offerd why we were there in April over my kids spring break. We stayed mid week in Oct. and found the pool was much quieter.The resort also offers a coin opperated laundry room, when I used this, I found it both clean and affordable. We had no isuues what so ever on either trip. On the last day of the April visit we asked for a tour of the property and details for booking group stays. Leigh showed us around and explain in detail about group bookings. We did end up booking our family reunion forJuly of 2011. I have not one regret over this choice. Our group contract clearly states that group discounts are only offered if we book 10 or more cabins! It's very clear that you are staying in a cabin not a hotel room. There is no maid service during your stay and although the resort gives you a starter pack of things like dish soap and toilet paper you need to provide these for yourself. This was made clear. It's a trade off one makes for more space over a typical hotel room. Also, prices for the Veranda rental are determined by the amount of cabins we book. I have found the staff to be a joy to work with. On our recent trip this past week once again I booked online. Our cabin was spotless! Gounds are beautiful! Never had a bug issue. We had a wonderful break from real world life. I would not hesitate to book here again. My only word of advice would be to make sure you book a premium or platinum cottage as the older standard cottages are well worn and not worth staying in in my opinion. This is a great family friendly resort. My kids are 7,10 and 12. Everyone in my family enjoyed our stays here. I can't wait for our family reunion here next July although I'm sure will be back before then to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: crpdetail
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this place for years and loved it. This time me and my girlfriend decided to get married there in the veranda. We had 4 different cabins with 17 people in them. We were told that we get a discount if we had more then 10 people. Will that never happened and I was laughed at every time I asked about it.Our cottage. A/C did not work when we checked in which was fixed pretty fast. There were candy all over the floors that housekeeping didn't bother picking up they just swept them in the corner.We were scheduled there for 7 days and were told there was a $50.00 charge for housekeeping to clean and change the linen while we were there. We ran out of toilet paper after the 3rd day and had to buy more because they would not supply more..one of the cottages had a rat in the wall. They called the front desk and was told someone would take care of it and no one showed up.I use to like this place but I saw angry employees who did not like there boss and we suffered. Bad management has caused us not to like this place anymore. I would rather stay in a $25.99 hotel room then stay here again.We also noticed some employees had a bad attitude toward the manager so there is a management problem too.We left a day early and didn't even get asked why we were leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Hilde_Nancy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there in 2008 and 2009 and we are going back late August 2010. We reallt enjoy to stay there. It´s quiet, near IHOP, Publix and Old Town. Not so far away from Disney. Friendly staff. The only things who makes us give 4 stars instead of 5 is that on top of the kitchen closet is it dusty and that the cleaners move around our tings when they clean. We always stay in the cheapest cottage, I know they have some cottages wiht a better standard. And there is a pool and a little "resturant" beside it. And a grill where you can make food. The cottage have 2 bedrooms a loft, kitchen, bath and a little "livingroom". There is a tv and free internett (last year, don´t know this year). So for us is this the only alternative when we visit Orlando. We have a son (12) and a daughter (19) and this year we will have with us a friend and my daughters boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Great higher end campground with amenities -- lovely cottages”
Reviews.Author: stuartrmwatson
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times before our most recent trip. Those times, it was in their standard cottages which were quite nice at the time. However, those particular models (although a great price) have not been well tended in recent years. They seem to be replacing them, though, with newer, and higher end cottages (the platinum we stayed in was quite nice.) We had originally booked into one of the older cottages, (and looked at another older cottage after we mentioned that the first was in bad shape). Regardless, we discussed with the fine folks at the front counter and advised we would be willing to pay more for something newer. Bless them, they provided a platinum cottage at a great rate. The newer cottages are beautiful and well equipped, and I highly recommend them. As for the property, it is still kept in great shape. The location is great. The staff is professional and friendly. (Oh, and there was wireless internet....not speedy, but adequate. An improvement in speed would be nice) We will be back. .

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!!”
Reviews.Author: keral1229
Reviews.Content: Fire ants out of control!!!Got 3 bites over the weekend.Spent July 4th weekend .Camped.Had standard site alongside another family group. As soon as we pulled in noticed ant mounds ALL over.Called office-they sent two guys with chemical sprayer. Didn't help. Ants crawled into bathroom. Yuck!Bring your Amdro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definatley stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: manateeRV
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first camping trip with our new camper. We picked TP because it was only about 2 hours from home, not too far if everything went bad. To be honest with your, with have mostly all good things to say about this campground. The facilites were clean and very well maintained. The shower houses were very clean, and well maintained. The grounds were well groomed, The staff was friendly and helpful. A thing that we noticed, was that this campground was definately geared up to be family oriented. Unlike most parks in florida that seem to cater to the senior citizen crowd. The pool sometimes seemed a little out of control. Some of the older teens seemed a little overly rowdy at times.Even with park staff in the area, Some of the sites seemed a little tight to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl8432
Reviews.Content: Previous stays at this resort had been great, so booked again this year. What a disappointment! Cottage was rusty, musty and had ants. Another party in our group stayed in a "premium" cottage and left early because his back couldn't take another night on the bed. It's always disappointing when a previous gem loses it's luster.

Reviews.Title: “Best Florida Vacation so far”
Reviews.Author: barbark2003
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother and I along with my Son and his family of 5 stayed here for 10 days. We rented 2 cottages, a studio for the 3 of us, and a 2 bedroom superior cottage for my Son's family. The studios are older and basic. The 2 bedroom cottage was beautiful with a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms with comfortable beds, living room with flat screen TV, DVD player and crown molding and tiled floors. The pool area is beautiful and well maintained, as were the entire resort The laundry facilities are nice, with about 20 washers and 10 dryers. They have a small store on site where you can buy the basics. We were right down the street from Disney (about 3 miles or less) and right behind Old Town which is nice with the different events and shops and rides. We strolled the grounds everyday, walking to the small lake to see the gators and turtles. This is an excellent place for families, either renting a cottage or camping. We had a little trouble with our studio door sticking and they sent someone right out. He was unable to get it to open easily for my 82 year old mother so they moved us immediately. The check in was quick as well as the check out. The folks that work at the office are very nice and helpful. This is probably the 5th time my family has stayed here but it has been about 10 years since the last time. It has improved with every stay. This will forever be my Orlando hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny-very clean-with strong smells and bugs”
Reviews.Author: lalasol
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to objective, but I felt compelled to write a review to help others because the cons far outweighed the pros for us. ( We went to a local hotel at midnight) Here goes: Pros: Reasonable price, spotless trailer, central location, decent looking cafe, planned activities (donut eating contest, dj, movie on blow-up screen, etc) Cons: 1) Obnoxious cinammon smell that permeated the trailer - which we were told was an ant killer...it smelled like this in 3 of our 4 cabins. The smell bothered some families more than others. 2) Bugs in cabin, including a GIANT cockroach that visited with the lights still on, Japanese beatle and some other prehistoric looking bug = all within about 45 minutes while we watched tv at the end of the night. 3) No lifeguard on duty, and the pool was too small for the amount of cabins. It would be ok if it wasn't crowded. During Mem.Day, it was elbow-elbow in the pool and I was worried that someone would injure another swimmer. 4) Horrible mattresses-the kids said they could feel the springs. 5) Tight sleeping quarters - 3 tiny twin beds sandwiched in, one full sized bed and one sofa. Good luck :)

Reviews.Title: “I Felt Like I Was Going To Cry When I Left!”
Reviews.Author: nursing37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tropical Plams with my family for ten days. We needed one house for our family, and our cousins would pay for a cabin for theirs since we went together. We ended up getting 2 cottages right beside each other which was perfect for us! Our family was of six people..which was a little squishy because there was 2 bedrooms one with a queen bed and one with 2 twin beds. There was also a pull-out couch which 2 people had to sleep on in our case.We were luxky to get a laundry room in our cabin because barely any have a laundry room. The store where we you could buy food, candy, souvineirs, and tickets to Disney was right behind our cabin so we could just walk to it. For landscape there is a little pond with a fence around it up high so no one can get near has alligators that swim around which was cool to see. There no place to eat there, so I would recommend bringing some cereal or other food or just go tho a restaurant nearby the resort. The pool is fantastic there a tons or lawn chairs around for you to relax and tan on, and some tabled with umbrellas. Right near the pool, was a splash pad/ kiddie pool. Also right on the pool deck was a mini bar. You could get ice cream, frozen yogurt, drinks, smoothies etc. At night there was pool light if the kids wanted to go swimming at night which we loved to do! The staff brought fresh towls everytime we used some.Our family was very sad when we left the resort we absolutely loved Tropical Palms and would go back anyday!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: glucasnc
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay!!! We rented one of the premium cottages. It was perfect for us(2 adults,1 teenager and a dog) We had a full kitchen,dining area,living area w/a flat screen tv,2 bedrooms,a bathroom and a deck w/patio table and chairs. It was fully stocked w/towels,soap,shampoo,coffee,dish detergent etc. We stayed here 3 years ago and they have all new management now! What a huge difference! Everything has been upgraded and the staff are so friendly and helpful. I highly recommend staying here especially if you have a pet. You are also close to everything. Disney is only 4 miles away!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Palms”
Reviews.Author: LindaJ4
Reviews.Content: This place has been the best priced family oriented location! Close to Disney, has pool. Don't let the campground scare off regulars of hotels. They have cabins that are nicer than some of the motels in the area. Only thing missing is room service. BUT - you do get a kitchenette - great for families on a budget! I have returned every couple of years just to see how the place has grown.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great BUT--”
Reviews.Author: Snowbirder422
Reviews.Content: We like this park because it is close to all the good attractions and easily accessible from I-4 and I-Drive. However for our large RV and car trailer some of the sites are difficult (at best) to get out of. All sites are cramped and when it rains, look out!! The concrete patios are in the middle of the site, so the door opens to the "grass" which washes out and becomes mud. Some sites cannot get satellite receiption. The office is very friendly and tries hard to please most guests. They are also working hard to update the place. I don't believe we would come back here because of the closeness and water issues.

Reviews.Title: “if you got kid's this is the place for you !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoFL_Bartmann
Reviews.Content: we stay at tropical palm's 5 or 6 times A year my kid's love it are kids are 5 and 7 and thay all way's have so much to do for them we have A RV. and it's so nice to go to A camp ground that has kid's in mind . trust me camp grounds in florida cador to old people but this place loves kids and thay are safe at the resort and allways sad when we go home !!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: Needsumnow
Reviews.Content: Four adults and two small dogs stayed in one of the condo units for two nights. Unit included a king-size bed in one room (bed takes up most of the space but we were able to place open suitcases side by side in the closet). Second bedroom has two single beds with large space in between and same closet space. Living room with sleeper sofa, side chair, TV (8 channels), newish stereo hidden above TV, small dining table with 4 chairs. Bath included sink, toilet and full tub. Having one bath was not a problem-if someone had to "go", there were the camping unit bathhouses available. Unit interior looked and smelled new-gorgeous appliances and cabinetry, sofa a bit tired, a few marks on wall from dining table and one bathroom slat broken. Was informed on check-in that pool was closed due to emergency maintenance, however, there is no emergency about digging up the concrete surrounding pool - clearly it was scheduled maintenance. There is a small lake with two small gators, several turtles and many fish (how did that 2 footer get in there) - you're not supposed to feed gators in Florida but folks were doing it anyway saying they were feeding the turtles. Check-out was smooth even though the front desk guy tried to bark at me about my not having paid the pet fee. When I pointed out that the confirmation I had been given at check-in was not my confirmation and I had no way to confrm my paying the pet fee, he calmed down considerably. He had one of the staff check our unit for pet damage and within 5 minutes, we were done. A/C worked wonderfully as it was in the 80's with humidity the whole time we were there. The exterior chairs and table could have used a good scrubbing but we did not use due to heat and showers. There were many campers but we hardly saw anyone - may be due to the heat. Only bug problem we had was a lizard gaining entrance while we were entering - I helped him exit via broomstick. We did have to park about 3 car lengths from our unit (a whole lot closer than any hotel room I've stayed in) and no one was using the other 3 units that we shared the courtyard with or this may have been a different review. Will use the Tropical Palms in the future when traveling with our pets. Good value, close to Disney and close to many dining options.

HotelInfo.Name: Tropical Palms Resort and Campground
HotelInfo.Address: 2650 Holiday Trail, Kissimmee, FL 34746 (Formerly Tropical Palms FunResort)
